fields.description:
*Properties merging over env*
 * URL -> dev env -> URL
 * Features (List) -> default env -> dev env
 * Properties -> merge

--> Create story for further discussions.

--> Idea: No "magic" merging for deeper properties.

--> Provide: UI support for copy.

Â 

*UUID:*

how to handle uuid?
 * public api, mod files, jar files. a lot of effort
 * rest client editor should create a nice "identifier" as key. name must be modeled as seperate entitiy.

Â 

*File:*
 - *rest-clients.yaml* vs restclients.yaml vs restClients.yaml
 - *webservice-clients.yaml* vs webserviceclients.yaml vs webserviceClients.yaml

Â

fields.description:
In the engine cockpit system configuration and application coniguration table, there are some strange properties listed if there are list properties configured in a yaml file.

E.g if you have the following in the ivy.yaml file:
{code:java}
bla:
  - asdf
  - asdfasdf
{code}
In addition to the normal entry for the list (bla: asdf,asdfasdf) there is a _bla.collection-type entry which is not really needed and helpful.

!image-2021-04-23-09-32-26-872.png!
fields.summary: Wrong additional configuration entry for list values in Engine Cockpit

fields.description:
Large OpenAPIs like ms-graph roll-out updates to their APIs frequently (e.g. once per month for microsoft).

Now, these API changes can break our existing Market-Demos quit easily. The reason is, that our generated swagger-client contains a lot of anonymous 'Body123' and InputWrapper classes.

!bodyInputType_anonymousBody.png|thumbnail!

These Body classes are generated for each 'resource-input' entity which does not have a concrete name in the OpenAPI of the vendor.

*Workaround*:
 * re-generate the OpenAPI client against the new spec
 * re-select the used resource in the OpenAPI method browser -> the correct new body-type will be taken
 * sample fix: [https://github.com/axonivy/market/pull/80/commits/29276e795edb7c4ba44098a081ac871a55f61643]

*Idea*:

try to introduce a more stable name .e.g (Body_myResource) which will be valid even if a hundred other new APIs have been introduced.

*Analysis*:
 * the 'InlineModelResolver' generates these 'body' types while parsing the OpenAPI. So we could customize that procedure.
!inlineModelResolver.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Stabilize generated Body123 interfaces for OpenAPI evolutions

fields.description:
As ivyTeam
 we want to analyze how system database entities can be cached in multi engine environment
 so that the number of requests to the system database can be reduced.

Ideas:
 * Instead of the current cache advisor algorithm use:
 ** Request based caching (task, case only per request)
 ** Time based caching (app,pm,pmv only cachei it for 10 sec)
 ** Counter based caching
 *** Cache as long as a counter has the same value,
 *** Store the counter in sys db table and cache per request
 *** Store In ZooKeeper
 * Analyze Distributed Caches products (that can be used with Hibernate)

Improve current Cache Implementation
 * make critical sections as small as possible
 * improve memory consumption
 * reduce cpu usage

Current Fintech Patche:

[https://bitbucket.org/axonivy-prod/ivy-core-branch-70/branch/fintech/object-assoc-cache]

Â 

Compare old and new implementation:

!image-2021-06-29-13-35-04-594.png!
fields.summary: Analyze and improve how to cache system database entity in multi engine environment

fields.description:
As Axon.ivy
 we want to limit the number of nodes a customer can run with an Enterprise Edition licence
 so that he cannot workaround the session limit by introducing any number of nodes

The total number of allowed session a customer can work with is then:

total sessions = number of nodes * number of sessions per node

Any other better idea to limit an Enterprise Edition?

Remove ClusterName from Licence and put it into ivy.yaml.

Â

fields.description:
Synchronize deployment in a cluster so that only one node deploys a project to a pmv. The other nodes should only copy the project files without doing a real deployment.

Move cache invalidation code on other nodes out of low level bundle to the deployment code. Only the deployment code needs to be communicating with other nodes during deployment and not all involved bundles.

fields.description:
As Process Developer I want that a dialog created with the New Dialog Wizard also has a Cancel Button (and a cancel logic) so that I don't have to implement a cancel function by myself all the time.

Â 

See the attached sample of a CancelableDialog.

Cancel logic:
 * Resets the task
 * Redirects to the task list over a default cancel page (See https://axonivy.atlassian.net/browse/IVYPORTAL-10771)
 * 

Be cautious that this also works correct with IFrames.

Cancel logic can be in a java bean
fields.summary: New Created Dialogs with a Cancel Button

fields.description:
As Axon Ivy
 we want a confluence page with possible technologies and competitors 
 so that we can document what they are making good and bad.

[Next Gen Designer - Axon Ivy Platform - AXON IVY Confluence|https://axonivy.atlassian.net/wiki/display/XIVY/Next+Gen+Designer]

Confluence page per technology and competitors with pro and cons of the solutions.

Which concepts could we take over or can influence our next generation designer.

Target is to collect a lot of information so that we can decide which technologies and competitors we want to look at closer in follow up stories. The page should also provide a lot of links so that Developers, PM and GL can also see what is possible and available.

Â
fields.summary: Analyse possible technologies and competitors for the next generation designer

fields.description:
GLSP features with reliable development strategy for the future: 
 so that we will introduce new features with good test coverage and drive an architecture that is continuously improved.
 - *dev-environment setup*: document in common space, start continuous improvement of common road-blocks, time consumers
 - *testing strategy*: test it like any other product feature
 ** unit tests for node features
 ** integration tests to nail critical platform specific issues (webKit vs fireFox vs edge)
 ** Selenium for simple go, no go test in different browsers
 ** Mocha, Chai for complext tests in Typescript
 ** Any other cool test framework?
 - Screenshots for Doc

Â
fields.summary: Setup Development and Test strategy for GLSP/Node

IWA_TaskStart
 * TASKSTARTID
 * TASKELEMENTID
 * STARTREQUESTPATH
 * -USERFRIENDLYSTARTREQUESTPATH-


IWA_TaskEnd
 * TASKENDID
 * TASKELEMENTID
 * -JOINREQUESTPATH-
 * -USERFRIENDLYJOINREQUESTPATH-
 * JOINPATHID


IWA_TaskElement
 * TASKELEMENTID
 * PROCESSMODELVERSIONID
 * -NAME-
 * -DESCRIPTION-
 * PROCESSELEMENTID
 * JOINPATHES
 * KIND

Make the data immutable and not always update all this tables on access (on deployment).

fields.description:
Not having the maven mindset in ivyProjects today is very annoying. 

* almost all customers will today make use of ci/cd pipelines using maven ... so why shouldn't we give a prominent emphasis on maven features at Design time?
* different classes output dirs from maven build (/target/classes) vs .classpath (/classes) causes a lot of trouble in the field ... since m2e will silently use the real maven output rather than the configured /classes directory.
 
now where we have the freedom to be on a new release train 9.3, what hinders us to change that default as fast as possible?

fields.description:
The new market/maven concept forces users to add configurable parts into their static connector. Therefore important properties like the URI, usernames, passwords should be made scriptable/configurable via variables.yaml. 

Example: alfresco REST/OpenAPI connector with dynamic URI parts.

*Remarks*:

* we could re-use the JSP macro expression from soap -> 
{code:java}<%=ivy.var.myVoolUser%>{code}
* but we already have a standard JAX-RS templating mechanism in the URI: 
{code:java}http://host:{myPort}/api{code}
* so we may better re-use JAX-RS templating stuff in URIs and Property values
* maybe no new concept is required: as we can already inject path properties: with 'PATH.' prefixed properties -> 
{code:java}PATH.myPort = 1234{code}
* think of a generic concepts that works on all RDM? E.g. databases too?



*Concept:*

* implement config resolver to expand ivy.var values for all our configs (rest,webservice, db): 
** we already have a similar concept in .yaml files for password â there we provide $\{decrpyt: fdfasd} as generic resolver for the config stack 
** maybe the AppConfigSource stack should only have this resolver: so that we do not see strange effect in ivy.yaml â¦ where this resolver makes no sense
** it should be required to do bpm.exec adjustments therefore neither for REST, SOAP nor DBS.
* do not expand resolve the values while editing the RDMs, do not yet provide any editing support for it. However, try to make the content of $\{} expression compatible with a basic ivyScript â¦ so that users can write ivy.var.XYZ using an ivyScript editor and paste it onto an RDM property expression.
* existing dynamic configs:
** try to get rid of macro expressions in SOAP RDM: convert or deprecate if feasible
*** however: the new expressions should only solve \{ivy.var} expansions. And not be an accessor to the whole ivy.XYZ APIs.
** keep REST http:\{myHost}/api + PATH.myHost-property concept for itâs nice UI integration
** make ivy.engine.baseUrl resolvable in REST and SOAP alike.
** transform \{ivy.engine.baseUrl} which was introduce a few weeks ago into the the new $\{ivy.engine.baseUrl} format
* provide cockpit support: do not expand value by default â¦ setup metadata so that the cockpit knows about these special values. Try to streamline / generalize the password concept.
fields.summary: Support ${ivy.var.*} in configuration files (ivy.yaml, app.yaml, REST, SOAP, External Database, etc.)

fields.description:
As an Ivy system admin

I want to a configuration setting to restrict the number of deployment artifacts the Ivy Engine backs up.

This is especially useful in an CI/CD environment where we constantly deploy new version of our application on the Engine. Old deployment packaged get then backed up (which is good), but these backups can fill up the disk space over time.

The setting should either be by time or by number (or both), similar to the log files.

See new setting: Deployment.Backup.Keep
fields.summary: Limit number of deployment artifact backups

fields.description:
Make it simple to introduce new projects on an existing SCM workspace. Currently the default and not configurable location for new project is the workspace. But this is awkward for GIT projects: As it forces users to
 # create projects,
 # and copy them manually in the file system to the real location,
 # deleting them virtually in the workspace
 # and re-importing them from the new location

If we just show a simple 'location' selector as the 'New Java Project' wizard does, we can easily make things lots easier: However, maybe we can go one step further and directly allow to create stuff where one of the known GIT repos for eclipse is referring to.

!newProject_locationSelectorJava.png|thumbnail!!newProjectOnGitRepo.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Migrating AXIS2 or CXF services from 8.0.X to 9.3 brakes the calling activity mappings in most circumstances. So we should provide an automatic conversion, that makes the mappings compliant. Although still the user has to manually re-generate the CXF client itself ... which should cause less issues.

Keep mappings intact:
||Name||8.0.16||9.3 should||Example||
|AXIS2 complex 
 param mapping|arg0.myComplex.theValue=123|myComplex.theValue=123|eonWsdl|
|AXIS2 simple
 param mapping|arg0.theValue=123|parameters.theValue=123| [ivyEcho|http://test-webservices.ivyteam.io:8080/axis2/services/IvyEchoService?wsdl]|
|AXIS2 Underline 
 types|arg0.MY_COMPLEX.MY_VAL=123|MYCOMPLEX.MYVAL=123|eonWsdl|
|CXF Underline 
 types|MY_COMPLEX.myVal=123|MYCOMPLEX.myVal=123|eonWsdl|


Fix: IvyEchoService created with 8.0.16 can't be migrated to 9.3 ... operations are not displayed even after a re-generation.
 !ivyEchoService_cantConfigureAfterMigrationFrom8.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
After importing an Amazon connector into the Designer the existing project (demo) has maven dependency probems (Build path problems).

The connector itself has a dependency to the maven artifact com.axonivy.connector.aws:amazon-aws4-authenticator. This artifact is provided by maven repository maven.axonivy.com.

All dependent projects of the connector will have this dependency on their classpath (Maven Dependencies). For ivy projects this is not necessary and counter productive as the same library gets put on the runtime classpath multiple times. But that is another problem.

!image-2021-08-19-09-49-58-012.png!

However, depending on timing the it can be that the demo project is trying to resolve the dependency first. Then the dependency cannot be resolve because the repository setting in the connector is not considered when resolving the dependency from demo project.

If the dependency is first resolved for the connector project it works. Also if the dependency is already in your local maven repo it works.

fields.description:
Today with 9.3 we enforce the âMaven â Update Project Configuration' to run after each IAR import. As this will force the maven integration (m2e) to download referenced java dependencies for the IAR.

However, after running such an âupdateâ the build path change is propagated throughout the workspace: which leads to a NullPointException.



Analysis:

* bug in m2e as it is does not handle âremote projectsâ e.g. IARs where IResource.getLocation() will return null.

fields.description:
If an Axon Ivy Engine is located behind a reverse proxy then the client information in performance log entries are not correct.
This is because the performance log is written by a valve that is earlier in the execution chain than the RemoteAddrFilter that sets the correct remote addr according to the x-forwarded-for HTTP header
fields.summary: Client is not correctly logged in performance log if engine is located behind a reverse proxy
